nodes.label: Starship Concept Start
nodes.text: SpaceX initiates the fully reusable Starship vision, aiming to revolutionize space travel and cargo delivery beyond Earth.

nodes.label: Early Prototypes (Starhopper)
nodes.text: Initial low-altitude tests validate the Raptor engine, control systems, and prototype design. This phase demonstrated feasibility of reusable rocket stages.

nodes.label: SN Series Development
nodes.text: Prototypes SN5â€“SN15 tested structural integrity, flight control, and re-entry techniques. Incremental improvements were made in fuel efficiency and stability.

nodes.label: Super Heavy Integration
nodes.text: Integration of the Super Heavy booster with 33 Raptor engines enables full-stack orbital launches. Focus on maximizing payload capacity and booster reusability.

nodes.label: Orbital Flight Attempts
nodes.text: First full-stack flights tested orbital insertion, guidance, and booster recovery, highlighting key lessons for long-duration space missions.

nodes.label: Material Innovation
nodes.text: Transition from carbon fiber to stainless steel for enhanced structural strength, cost-effectiveness, and superior thermal resilience during re-entry.

nodes.label: Raptor Engine Evolution
nodes.text: Raptor engines evolve from Raptor 1 to Raptor 2, with improvements in thrust efficiency, reliability, and manufacturability to support frequent launches.

nodes.label: Thermal Protection System
nodes.text: Advanced hexagonal tiles protect Starship from extreme heat during repeated atmospheric re-entries, ensuring longevity and safety.

nodes.label: Ground Infrastructure
nodes.text: Starbase launch tower, catching arms, and propellant systems are built to support rapid turnaround launches and booster recovery operations.

nodes.label: Booster Recovery
nodes.text: Mechazilla arms capture boosters post-launch, enabling rapid reuse and cost reduction, revolutionizing space logistics.

nodes.label: Refueling in Orbit
nodes.text: Starship tankers transfer propellant in orbit, critical for deep-space missions including lunar and Martian operations.

nodes.label: Lunar Starship (HLS)
nodes.text: NASA Artemis mission variant optimized for lunar landings, demonstrating Starship's adaptability for human exploration beyond Earth.

nodes.label: Mars Transfer Mission
nodes.text: First cargo and crew transfer tests for Martian missions, validating Starship's long-duration orbital capabilities.

nodes.label: Mars Landing
nodes.text: Propulsive descent ensures safe landing on Mars, setting the stage for human presence and future exploration infrastructure.

nodes.label: Mars Base Alpha
nodes.text: First human settlement on Mars, constructed using Starship-delivered materials and autonomous construction systems.
